summary: The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions on Côte d'Ivoire, welcomes efforts by the Secretary-General, African Union, and ECOWAS to re-establish peace and stability. Recalling the Group of Experts' final report, it determines the situation in Côte d'Ivoire remains a threat to international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII, it extends the Group's mandate to 15 December 2006 and requests a brief written update by 1 December 2006 on the implementation of measures imposed by previous resolutions, with recommendations. The Council remains actively seized of the matter.
